title: Anomaly in conformal quantum mechanics: From molecular physics to black holes
abstract: A number of physical systems exhibit asymptotic conformal invariance. Within a particular range of distances, they are characterized by an inverse square potential, the absence of dimensional scales, and an SO(2,1) symmetry algebra. Examples ranging from molecular physics to black holes are provided. For such systems, quantum symmetry breaking -- revealed by the failure of the symmetry generators to close the algebra -- is shown to be independent of the renormalization procedure.
